snippet.textDisplay: I'd honestly be really disappointed if 100 Acre Wood isn't in KH3. It's actually not one of my favorite worlds but Pooh and the gang are such a series tradition if you ask me.
snippet.textOriginal: I'd honestly be really disappointed if 100 Acre Wood isn't in KH3. It's actually not one of my favorite worlds but Pooh and the gang are such a series tradition if you ask me.

snippet.textDisplay: I'd not just be disappointed (well, as much as I can be for not being a fan of KH), but I'd be surprised.

snippet.textDisplay: back when Kingdom Hearts was a self contained story....now you need a master's degree to even attempt to understand wtf is going on, im not even sure if I want to play Kingdom Hearts 3

snippet.textDisplay:
@Malcolm Swoboda It feels nice to look at these old comments through the lens of having played KH3.
Kinda like a time capsule before we all realized the KH writers have no idea what they're doing anymore.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Malcolm Swoboda It feels nice to look at these old comments through the lens of having played KH3.
Kinda like a time capsule before we all realized the KH writers have no idea what they're doing anymore.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Hatt Hanz
Oh yeah! I remember that too. I thought everyone was a new character for a while. Technically I never even finished CoM too. And when Jiminy's Journal added the rest of the Organization to it, I was like "Wait, what? Who are these people? I didn't see them."
snippet.textOriginal:
@Hatt Hanz
Oh yeah! I remember that too. I thought everyone was a new character for a while. Technically I never even finished CoM too. And when Jiminy's Journal added the rest of the Organization to it, I was like "Wait, what? Who are these people? I didn't see them."

snippet.textDisplay: @Hatt Hanz Ah, I did the same thing but didn't think that. I was only momentarily confused and aware that there were other events that happened, but at least the basic gist of all main story events of KH2 were comprehensible. It wasn't enough - on that I'd agree - but it wasn't *horrible*. IMO of course.
snippet.textOriginal: @Hatt Hanz Ah, I did the same thing but didn't think that. I was only momentarily confused and aware that there were other events that happened, but at least the basic gist of all main story events of KH2 were comprehensible. It wasn't enough - on that I'd agree - but it wasn't *horrible*. IMO of course.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Malcolm Swoboda i remember playing KH2 without playing Chains of Memories and thinking what the fuck was going on everytime scenes from that game appeared. 
Ican only assume KH3 will exponentiate that feeling even more trying to explain how we got to KH3 from KH2
snippet.textOriginal:
@Malcolm Swoboda i remember playing KH2 without playing Chains of Memories and thinking what the fuck was going on everytime scenes from that game appeared. 
Ican only assume KH3 will exponentiate that feeling even more trying to explain how we got to KH3 from KH2

snippet.textDisplay: While I agree that it is needlessly amazingly complicated, I'm almost certain that KH3 will relatively simplify things and only contain consistent noting of all those previous secondary titles. They'd all be helpful, perhaps 'too' helpful, but not necessarily required.
snippet.textOriginal: While I agree that it is needlessly amazingly complicated, I'm almost certain that KH3 will relatively simplify things and only contain consistent noting of all those previous secondary titles. They'd all be helpful, perhaps 'too' helpful, but not necessarily required.

snippet.textDisplay:
@dannywolfpero yeah, ill probably play it anyways, but i was 12 years old when I first played Kingdom Hearts. Im 24 now, and KH2 was the last in the franchise I played. 
I'll do it for the gameplay, nostalgia and closure, but I expect alot of awkwardness and cringy moments
snippet.textOriginal:
@dannywolfpero yeah, ill probably play it anyways, but i was 12 years old when I first played Kingdom Hearts. Im 24 now, and KH2 was the last in the franchise I played. 
I'll do it for the gameplay, nostalgia and closure, but I expect alot of awkwardness and cringy moments

snippet.textDisplay:
@dannywolfpero thats the problem isnt it? How the fuck can you expect your audience to play a shit ton of side games over countless consoles just to be able to somehow grasp what the fuck the story is about?
And mind you, I have watched and read countless videos and articles explaining the story detail by detail over every single game since KH2, and the conclusion I arrived is that the writters have no idea what the hell they are going for and are just making stuff up on the fly to somehow connect every single game in the franchise, its just a bunch of awful storytelling. My opinion anyways.
snippet.textOriginal:
@dannywolfpero thats the problem isnt it? How the fuck can you expect your audience to play a shit ton of side games over countless consoles just to be able to somehow grasp what the fuck the story is about?
And mind you, I have watched and read countless videos and articles explaining the story detail by detail over every single game since KH2, and the conclusion I arrived is that the writters have no idea what the hell they are going for and are just making stuff up on the fly to somehow connect every single game in the franchise, its just a bunch of awful storytelling. My opinion anyways.

snippet.textDisplay: The KH2 remake version is really gorgeous. This is too synthy for my tastes.

snippet.textDisplay: This sounds relaxing, like I'm sitting in a meadow among friends.
snippet.textOriginal: This sounds relaxing, like I'm sitting in a meadow among friends.

snippet.textDisplay: Still playing through Kingdom Hearts for the first time. I just remember being so enamored of this place when this song played. Just brought back nostalgia of, what, my toddler years when I used to watch Winnie the Pooh. It was so charming, I loved it! Now, I guess as I collect more Torn Pages, I'll see why people don't like 100 Acre Woods, but still.
snippet.textOriginal: Still playing through Kingdom Hearts for the first time. I just remember being so enamored of this place when this song played. Just brought back nostalgia of, what, my toddler years when I used to watch Winnie the Pooh. It was so charming, I loved it! Now, I guess as I collect more Torn Pages, I'll see why people don't like 100 Acre Woods, but still.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm pretty sure you'll keep having this feeling. Maybe the minigames could have been better, but it's a cute story!

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah it was a nice chill place
snippet.textOriginal: Yeah it was a nice chill place

snippet.textDisplay: This song is great. It really set the mood that this is a place untouched by evil (which isn't totally true, considering its pages are scattered across the worlds), and that you could just relax and not have to worry about anything.
snippet.textOriginal: This song is great. It really set the mood that this is a place untouched by evil (which isn't totally true, considering its pages are scattered across the worlds), and that you could just relax and not have to worry about anything.

snippet.textDisplay: 100 Acre Wood is a world where you can just take a break and hang out with Pooh and Friends. That's what I think but I could be wrong.

snippet.textDisplay: This theme is one of my favorites from KH. Its just so whimsical and nostalgic.

snippet.textDisplay: 100 Acre Woods is almost as good as Agrabah.

snippet.textDisplay: Is it possible to listen to this without a smile? (I just tested and the answer is yes, but still!). I'll be honest, I hated The 100 Acre Woods and the various mechanics in it, but its music was one of my favorites. Shimomura's touch on this classic theme is perfect.
snippet.textOriginal: Is it possible to listen to this without a smile? (I just tested and the answer is yes, but still!). I'll be honest, I hated The 100 Acre Woods and the various mechanics in it, but its music was one of my favorites. Shimomura's touch on this classic theme is perfect.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree, he did a great job with the theme. Brought back memories of my childhood, when I watched the Winnie the Pooh movies as a little boy. Any time I hear this theme, I have to smile, and it even brings tears of joy to my eyes.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree, he did a great job with the theme. Brought back memories of my childhood, when I watched the Winnie the Pooh movies as a little boy. Any time I hear this theme, I have to smile, and it even brings tears of joy to my eyes.

snippet.textDisplay: Same feeling for me, loved the music, hated the theme :)
snippet.textOriginal: Same feeling for me, loved the music, hated the theme :)
